p: DEET, picaridin, tea tree oil, peppermint oil, and citronella oil were tested for repellency activity on Triathoma rubida using small restrained rats. No long-range repellency was observed. Only citronella oil was able to stop all probing and feeding of T. rubida and appears to be a promising potential repellent to prevent sleeping people from being bitten by kissing bugs ( 41). The efficacy of any pesticide or repellent compound can vary with the testing method, rate of application, bed bug strain and physiological stage ( 17).
